title: Easy Flan Recipe
description: Caramelized sugar, milk and eggs—a sweet and simple baked custard.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European Spanish Easy Flan 4.4 (178) 153 Reviews 39 Photos The best dessert ever invented!! Submitted by Bobby Kleinveld Updated on April 11, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 39 39 39 39 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ½ cup white sugar 2 cups milk 2 eggs, beaten 2 egg yolks, beaten ⅜ cup white sugar Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a heavy bottomed saucepan over medium heat, melt 1/2 cup sugar until golden. Carefully pour hot sugar evenly into four oven-proof ramekins or custard cups, tilting cups to coat bottoms evenly. In another saucepan, bring milk just to boiling over medium heat. Stir hot milk, a little at a time, into beaten eggs and egg yolks, until well combined. Stir in sugar. Pour milk mixture evenly into ramekins. Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel. Place ramekins on towel, inside roasting pan, and place roasting pan on oven rack. Fill roasting pan with boiling water to reach halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake in preheated oven 40 minutes, until set. Let cool, invert and serve. I Made It Print 274 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Flan 01 of 39 Photo by  sanzoe 02 of 39 Photo by  OldAle1867 04/24/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Family favorite I did add a bit of vanilla bean and this is really good and so much better than the condensed milk. I also made one with Splenda in the mixture for my Dad who has diabetes and he loved it. 03 of 39 Photo by  Michelle Gebert-Oestreich 07/29/2020 04 of 39 Photo by  Sara Kerr Nekvinda 05/21/2020 05 of 39 Photo by  stlangel 05/06/2020 06 of 39 Photo by  Kuro Trn 11/11/2019 07 of 39 Photo by  jolovesu 11/03/2019 This recipe reminds me of the flan my family made when I was a girl. It was perfectly, delicately sweet. The texture is silky smooth. I did add a teaspoon of vanilla because I love the flavor. 08 of 39 Photo by  Reeh Rodriguez 10/09/2019 Recipe was easy to follow, I added a tablespoon of vanilla. The flan is silky and smooth. 09 of 39 Photo by  mirjaneth 10/07/2019 I had never before made a custard or any dessert like this before. The directions were easy to follow and it turned out beautifully and was so good to eat. name: Bobby Kleinveld
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;In a heavy bottomed saucepan over medium heat, melt 1/2 cup sugar until golden. Carefully pour hot sugar evenly into four oven-proof ramekins or custard cups, tilting cups to coat bottoms evenly.;In another saucepan, bring milk just to boiling over medium heat. Stir hot milk, a little at a time, into beaten eggs and egg yolks, until well combined. Stir in sugar. Pour milk mixture evenly into ramekins.;Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel. Place ramekins on towel, inside roasting pan, and place roasting pan on oven rack. Fill roasting pan with boiling water to reach halfway up the sides of the ramekins.;Bake in preheated oven 40 minutes, until set. Let cool, invert and serve.
